summary: This document is an email chain between law enforcement regarding a complaint filed by Mark Epstein. It details technical information about threatening text messages, including originating phone numbers, email addresses, and device IDs, with indications the messages may have originated from Iran.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: The complaint (2020-001-2753) is filed under his name, indicating he reported a threat.

events.title: NYPD Complaint Filed
events.description: A complaint (2020-001-2753) is filed by or on behalf of Mark Epstein regarding threatening text messages.

locations: Iran (as indicated origin of majority of IP addresses)
keyFacts: Mark Epstein filed a complaint (NYPD 2020-001-2753) regarding threatening text messages.
Technical analysis indicates the threats came from VOIP numbers 4302482541 and 6203229434, with associated email addresses and device IDs.
The IP addresses for the threats were jumping around using proxy servers, with the majority traced to Iran.
The correspondence is between law enforcement, specifically involving the FBI New York C-19 Violent Crimes Task Force and an NYPD detective.
